commitResults.messageTitle: Added task class and mark as done feature
Added deadline, event, and todo tasks
Add error messages for incorrect user input

commitResults.messageBody:
User will lose their task list in between every run.

Implement a file reader to store user's task list on hard disk.

This allows the user to retain their task list even with the
termination of the program.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make Task.java create tasks from user input
commitResults.messageBody:
Add task to list code is bulked up in Mortis.java. The chatbot first
creates a task from user input, then adds it to the list. This
compromises readability.

The common code in many of the user input cases cause code duplication.

Let's delegate reading user-input and creating a task into the Task
class, instead of making the main chat-bot handle each if-else case.

This utilises OOP well.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement file saving and loading in Mortis.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Mortis can only read files if they already existed in ip/.
She also cannot write to the same file.

Let's,
* add exception handling to create a new data file when none is found
* add code to save new task list to file

Test cases do not work for updated data storage function.

Let's,
* update EXPECTED.txt and input.txt for file reading and writing

commitResults.messageTitle: Update code to match Java coding standards
commitResults.messageBody:
There are no header descriptions for public classes and methods.

Add Javadoc headers for Mortis.java and Task.java.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-7' Finish implementing the Level 7 task of saving.
